titleStmt.title: Hell broke loose: or An history of the Quakers both old and new. Setting forth many of their opinions and practices. Published to antidote Christians against formality in religion and apostasie. By Thomas Underhill citizen of London.
titleStmt.author: Underhill, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Simon Miller at the Starre in St. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Stationer &" careted between "Underhill" and "citizen"; 9ber [i.e. November]. 13. 1659".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
